Package io.dimeformat

Class Envelope

java.lang.Object
io.dimeformat.Item
io.dimeformat.Envelope
public class Envelope extends Item
An encapsulating object that can carry one or more DiME items. This is usually the format that is exported and stored or transmitted. It will start with the header 'Di'. Envelopes may be either anonymous or signed. An anonymous envelope, most frequently used, is not cryptographically sealed, although the items inside normally are. A signed envelope can contain one or more items and is itself also signed, it also has a small number of claims attached to it.

      @Deprecated public static final int MAX_CONTEXT_LENGTH
      Deprecated.
      Will be removed in the future, use {#Dime.MAX_CONTEXT_LENGTH} instead.
      The maximum length that the context claim may hold. This is also used for the context claim in messages.

    • Envelope

      public Envelope​(UUID issuerId, String context)
      Constructor to create a signed envelope with the identifier of the issuer and a custom context claim. The context may be any valid text.
      Parameters:
      issuerId - The identifier of the issuer, may not be null.
      context - The context to attach to the envelope, may be null.

  • Method Details

    • getHeader

      public String getHeader()
      Description copied from class: Item
      Returns the item header of the DiME item. This can be used to identify the type of DiME item held in this generic class. It is also used in the exported DiME format to indicate the beginning of a DiME item inside an envelope. Typically, this is represented by a short series of letters.
      Specified by:
      getHeader in class Item
      Returns:
      The item header of the DiME item.

    • getItems

      public List<Item> getItems()
      Returns any attached Di:ME items. This will be an array of Item instances and may be cast by looking at the tag of the item (getTag).
      Returns:
      An array of Item instance

    • isAnonymous

      public boolean isAnonymous()
      Indicates if the envelope is anonymous (true) or if it is signed (false).
      Returns:
      true or false

    • importFromEncoded

      public static Envelope importFromEncoded​(String encoded) throws InvalidFormatException
      Imports an envelope from a Di:ME encoded string. This will not verify the envelope, this has to be done by calling verify separately.
      Parameters:
      encoded - The encoded Di:ME envelope to import.
      Returns:
      The imported Envelope instance.
      Throws:
      InvalidFormatException - If the format of the encoded envelope is wrong.

    • addItem

      public void addItem​(Item item)
      Adds a DiME item (of type Item or any subclass thereof) to the envelope. For signed envelopes, this needs to be done before signing the envelope. It is not possible to add an item twice to an envelope.
      Parameters:
      item - The DiME item to add.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - If envelope is already signed or an item is added twice.
      IllegalArgumentException - If an envelope is being added.

    • setItems

      public void setItems​(List<Item> items)
      Adds a list of DiME items (of type Item or any subclass thereof) to the envelope. For signed envelopes, this needs to be done before signing the envelope. It is not possible to add an item twice to an envelope.
      Parameters:
      items - The DiME items to add.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - If envelope is already signed or an item is added twice.
      IllegalArgumentException - If an envelope is being added.

    • getItem

      public <T> Item getItem​(Claim claim, T value)
      Returns any item in the envelope that matches a specified claim and value. If no item could be found, then this will return null. Provided claim value must not be null.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The class of the claim value provided.
      Parameters:
      claim - The claim for which the provided value should be compared with.
      value - The value of the claim that should be searched for.
      Returns:
      The found item, or null if none could be found.

    • getItems

      public <T> List<Item> getItems​(Claim claim, T value)
      Returns any items in the envelope that matches a specified claim and value, If no items could be found, then this will return an empty array. Provided claim value must not be null.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The class of the claim value provided.
      Parameters:
      claim - The claim for which the provided value should be compared with.
      value - The value of the claim that should be searched for.
      Returns:
      The matching item or items, as a list, will be empty if none where found.

    • getItem

      @Deprecated public Item getItem​(String context)
      Deprecated.
      This is deprecated and will be removed in future versions, use getItems(Claim, Object) or getItems(Claim, Object) instead.
      Returns any item inside the envelope that matches the provided context (ctx).
      Parameters:
      context - The context to look for.
      Returns:
      The found item, or null if none was found.

      Returns:

    • sign

      public void sign​(Key signingKey) throws CryptographyException
      Signs the envelope using the provided key. The key must be of type IDENTITY. It is not possible to sign an anonymous envelope. It is also not possible to sign an envelope if it already has been signed or does not contain any DiME items.
      Overrides:
      sign in class Item
      Parameters:
      signingKey - The key to use when signing.
      Throws:
      CryptographyException - If something goes wrong.

    • verify

      public IntegrityState verify​(Key verifyKey, List<Item> linkedItems)
      Description copied from class: Item
      Verifies the integrity and over all validity and trust of the item. If a key is provided, then verification will use that key. If verifyKey is omitted, then the local key ring will be used to verify signatures of the item.
      Overrides:
      verify in class Item
      Parameters:
      verifyKey - Key used to verify the item, may be null.
      linkedItems - A list of item where item links should be verified, may be null.
      Returns:
      The integrity state of the verification.

    • exportToEncoded

      public String exportToEncoded()
      Exports the envelope to a Di:ME encoded string.
      Overrides:
      exportToEncoded in class Item
      Returns:
      The DiME encoded representation of the envelope.

    • generateThumbprint

      public String generateThumbprint() throws CryptographyException
      Returns the thumbprint of the envelope. This may be used to easily identify an envelope or detect if an envelope has been changed. This is created by securely hashing the envelope and will be unique and change as soon as any content changes.
      Overrides:
      generateThumbprint in class Item
      Returns:
      The hash of the envelope as a hex string.
      Throws:
      CryptographyException - If something goes wrong.
